intro: Forsteronia adenobasis, commonly known as the velvetleaf. It is a tropical shrub belonging to the Malvaceae family, characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. Forsteronia adenobasis is often found in moist, shaded environments in tropical regions.
